Summary: The Lord's Preface to the Doctrine and Covenants
The coming of Elijah to turn the hearts of the children to the fathers
Context: Moroni appears in the middle of the night when Joseph is 17

Summary: 116 Pages Pt 1. It is not the work of God that is frustrated, but the work of men
Joseph Smith Senior is called to embark in the service of God
116 Pages Pt 2. Martin Harris is forgiven and encouraged to have faith, even without a witness.
Oliver Cowdery joins Joseph. Cast your mind upon the night that you cried unto me in your heart. Did I not speak peace to your mind concerning the matter?
Joseph and Oliver Cowdery learn about revelation through a translation of a record of John the Beloved, revealed in the hat method
Joseph and Oliver - Behold I will tell you in your mind and in your heart, by the Holy Ghost which shall come upon you and which shall dwell in your heart.
Joseph and Oliver - You must study it out in your mind, if it is right, I will cause that your bosom shall burn within you.
116 Pages Pt 3. The Lord reveals Satan's plan to use the stolen pages to undermine the translation
Verse: Pray Always, that you may come off conqueror; yea that you may conquer Sata, and that you may escape the hands of the servants of Sata that do uphold his work

Summary: Hyrum is called to the work. Seek not to declare my word, but first seek to obtain my word and then shall your tongue be loosed
Joseph Knight is called to the work.
Verse: No one can assist in this work except he shall be humble and full of love, faith, hope, and charity
Context: Joseph Smith met the Knight family when he was hired as a day laborer during the Colesville/Josiah Stoal/Treasure Hunt and lived with them while courting Emma (a distance of 20 miles from Harmony). In May 1829, Joseph and Oliver needed paper and supplies and Joseph Knight brought them provisions. It is likely during that visit that this revelation occurred
Consequences: Joseph Smith said, "For fifteen years has he been faithful and true, and even handed, and exemplary, and virtuous, and kind…It shall be said of him that this man was a faithful man in Israel; Therefore his name shall never be forgotten

Summary: John the Baptist restores Aaronic Priesthood Keys
Verse: Upon you my fellow servants, in the name of Messiah I confer the Priesthood of Aaron.

Summary: David Whitmer called to the work and is counseled to endure to the end and become a witness of the things which you shall hear and see. 1st of the Whitmer brother sections
John Whitmer called to the work. 2nd of Whitmer brother sections
Peter Whitmer called to the work. 3rd of Whitmer brother sections
Three Witnesses are called to testify of what they have seen. Including the plates, the sword of Laban, and the Urim and Thummim
Three Witnesses will call the Apostles. Remember the worth of Souls is Great in the Sight of God
Verse: Remember the Worth of Souls is Great in the Sight of God

Summary: Martin Harris is asked to sacrifice his wealth for the printing of the book of Mormon. Jesus shares a first-hand account of his suffering during the atonment.
The Articles and Covenants of the Church, separated into History, Beliefs, and an outline of the Ordinances.
Give heed unto Joseph Smith the Prophet. When you do, the Lord God will disperse the powers of darkness and cause the Heavens to shake for your good.
Although a man should be baptized an hundred times it availeth him nothing unless done in the New and Everlasting Covenant

Synthesis of 5 revelations to 5 people. Hyrum Smith is told that his tongue is loosed, Samuel Smith is called to exhortation and shortly leaves on the mission that will lead to Brigham Young's conversion.
Joseph Smith is told to be patient in afflictions, for he shall have many. And in temporal labors he shall not have strength, for that is not his calling
Emma Smith is called an elect lady and comforted in her calling as comforter to Joseph Smith
All things shall be done by common consent in the church, by much prayer and faith.
It mattereth not what you shall eat or what you shall drink when ye partake of the sacrament, if it so be that ye do it with an eye single to my glory.
Story of Hiram Page - No one shall be appointed to receive commands and revelations in this church excepting my servant Joseph Smith Junior.
Verse: No one shall be appointed to receive commands and revelations in this church excepting my servant Joseph Smith Junior.

Summary: All things unto me are spiritual
Verse: I say unto you that all things unto me are spiritual and not at any time have I given unto you a law which was temporal… Behold I gave unto him that he should be an agent unto himself and I gave unto him commandments
Context: Some were intrigued about the book of Mormon prophect of a Zion in America. And this may also serve to correct some misunderstandings that arose from Hiram Page's seer stone revelations. This revelation occurs around the same time period that Joseph was translating the first few chapters of Genesis, published as the Book of Moses.
Content: This revelation tackles two main questions. (1) Zion, the New Jerusalem, Millenium. (2) Adam, agency, and the premortal life.

Summary: Oliver Cowdery and Peter Whitmer are called to go on a mission and build up the church among the Lamanites
Thomas B. Marsh - Lift up your heart and rejoice, for the hour of your mission is come
Parley P Pratt and Ziba Peterson are called to join Oliver Cowdery and Peter Whitmer on their mission to the Lamanites
Open your mouths and they shall be filled - Ezra Thayre and Northrop Sweet
Orson Pratt is called to preach the gospel
Sidney Rigdon - The Lord says, "I have looked upon thee and thy works. I have heard thy prayers, and prepared thee for a greater work."
Edward Partridge is called to preach the gospel with the sound of a trump
A commandment I give unto the church, that it is expedient in me that they should assemble together at the Ohio

I commanded you to go to the Ohio, and there I will give unto you my law; and there you shall be endowed with power from on high. And they that have farms that cannot be sold, let them be left or rented as seemeth them good.
James Covel has been prepared for a greater work and is called not into the Eastern Countries but to the Ohio
James Covel received the word with gladness but the cares of the world caused him to reject the calling. It remaineth with God to do with Covel as seemeth Him good.
Edward Partridge is ordained as Bishop to the Church
The Law of Consecration, given to the saints in Kirtland Ohio
There is none other appointed unto you to receive commandments and revelations until Joseph Smith be taken. Calling to teach come through Church channels instead of personal callings.
Missionaries are called to gather and preach in and around Kirtland Ohio
Context: For the law of consecration to work, you need people. You also have all the eastern states coming. So the Lord calls a big transfer meeting. Elders from all over get reassigned to the "Regions round about Kirland" to strengthen the new base of the church

Summary: Signs of the Times - Commentary on Olivet Discourse (Matthew 24, Mark 13, Luke 21)
Spiritual Gifts in the Restored Church
Verse: Seek Ye Earnestly the best gifts… they are given for the benefit of those who love me and keep all my commandments and him that seeketh so to do.

Summary: John Whitmer called as Church historian
Verse: It is expedient that John should write and keep a regular history

Summary: Settle in Kirtland for now but save your money for the next move to Zion
Verse: Ye should remain for the present time in your places of abode… save all the money you can … they shall lay the foundation of the city of zion and then ye shall begin to be gathered

Summary: Revelation to the Shakers
Context: There was a large community of Shakers in the area, and Leman Copley was trying to live in his old community and his new community.

Summary: The Spirit of God is Light not Deception
Verse: He that preacheth and he that receiveth understand one another and both are edified and rejoice together

Summary: Saints are made stewards of property
Verse: Let my servant Edward Partridge appoint unto this people their portions according to their circumstances, wants, and needs
Context: Bishop Partridge asked for help in getting the Colesville and other eastern members settled in Kirland.

Summary: Next conference shall be in Missouri, the land of your inheritance. Additionally, many elders are called on missions and given assignments
Verse: Let Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon take their journey as soon as preparations can be made and journey to Missouri

Summary: Sidney Gilbert called to Missouri to be an agent unto the Church
Context: Sidney Gilbert moves to Missouri and stays a strong member the rest of his life

Summary: Colesville Saints Called to Missouri
Context: The Colesville Branch was living on Leman Copley's farm (section 51) but Copley goes back to the Shakers (section 49) and kicks them out so they are commanded to go to Missouri

Summary: William W. Phelps called to the work of printing, selecting and writing books for the Church and its children
Context: William W. Phelps was an experienced writer and publisher. He received a book of Mormon from Parley P. Pratt and stayed up all night reading. He became the Church Printer. He left the church between 1839 and 1841 but then came back, moved to Utah, and died while serving as an ordinance worker in the endowment house

Summary: The Lord Chastises those who do not follow his commandments with their whole heart. Mission assignments from section 52 need to change because Thayre and Copley are not ready to serve missions
Context: After being called on a mission, Thayre moves slowly and because Leman Copley forced the Colesville Saints to leave, some adjustments to the assignments of section 52 are needed.

Summary: Zion shall be established in Missouri
Content: Joseph and many Elders arrive in Independence and declare that it is the land of Zion

Summary: Men should be anxiously engaged in a good cause - specifically building Zion
Context: You made it to Zion. Now what? Go to work and build with your own hands, using your best judgement. Joseph Smith will be far away and won't be available to consult with rapid answers.

Summary: Zion is a place but also a people who honor God with willing hearts and keep the Sabbath.
Verse: That thou mayest more fully keep thyself unspotted from the world, thou shalt go to the house of prayer and offer up thy sacraments upon my holy day.
Context: Polly Knight, of the Colesville branch, got sick on the journey to Missouri and died shortly after reaching Zion. She was a Zion person and her legacy, in contrast to the Missourians, prompted this relevation about keeping the Sabbath day holy

Summary: Joseph called to return from Missouri to Kirtland - Go Speedily but not in haste
Verse: Thus saith the Lord unto the Elders of His Church who are to return speedily unto the land from whence they came. Let there be a craft made or bought and take your journey from St. Louis then to Cincinnati
Consequences: On August 9, Joseph and 10 other brethren head down the Missouri river on canoes bound for St. Louis

Summary: Waters can be dangerous but God will not forsake us
Verse: None is able to go up to Zion upon the waters but he that is upright in heart. Let them journey two by two

Summary: Some things are left up to your judgement and personal revelation
Verse: Ye are blessed, for the testimony which ye have borne is recorded in heaven and your sins are forgiven you … These things remain with you to do according to judgment and the directions of the Spirit
Context: On the way back to Ohio, Joseph meets a group of missionaries led by Hyrum.
Content: We bring joy to Heaven when our ancestors see us bearing testimony.
Consequences: Hyrum goes to Missouri, holds the meeting discussed in this section and then turns around and goes back to Kirland

Summary: After returning from Zion, Joseph instructs the saints about becoming a Zion people
Verse: To him that keepeth my commandments I will give the mysteries of the Kingdom and the same shall be in him a well of Living Water
Context: Upon returning from Missouri, Joseph has some incredible stories to tell but he finds some discontent and confusion. In response, this revelation outlines many directions concerning sign-seeking, adultery, faith, and keeping the commandments.

Summary: The Prophet makes mistakes but we need to forgive and follw with a willing heart
Verse: There are those who have sought occastion against Joseph Smith without cause… The Lord will forgive whom I will forgive but of you it is required to forgive all men.
Context: Some discontent was forming among some of the members of the church (e.g., Ezra Booth, Symonds Ryder). So the Lord told the saints to forgive the Prophet, forgive each other, and work to build a spiritual and physical Zion
Content: I, the Lord, will retain a stronghold in Kirtland for the space of 5 years. Wherefore be not weary in well-doing for ye are laying the foundation of a great work.

Summary: A prayer for the gospel to fill the Earth
Verse: The Keys of the Kingdom of God are committed unto man on the earth, and from thence shall the gospel roll forth unto the ends of the earth as the stone cut out of the mountain without hands
Context: Joseph said it came by revelation as a kind of prayer. It synthesizes references from Isaiah 33:22, the Lord's Prayer (Matt 6), and Daniel 2:44.

Summary: William E McLellin called to the work
Verse: Blessed are you for receiving mine everlasting covenant, even the fullness of my gospel, sent forth unto the children of men
Context: William McLellin asked the Lord to answer 5 questions through Joseph Smith. Without telling Joseph about the questions, he asked Joseph to provide him God's will.
Consequences: McLellin spent the rest of his long life outside the church, struggling to resolve the tension between his testimony of the revelation and his unwillingness to follow it.

Summary: Preparations to publish the revelations
Verse: (5) Your eyes have been on my servant Joseph Smith Jr. and his imperfections you have known… and you have sought in your hearts knowledge that you might express beyond his language. (6-7) Appoint him that is most wise among you to try to make one like it, then ye are justified in saying that you do not know that they are true.
Context: In preparation to print the book of Commandments and around the same time as section 1, some of the elders are hesitant to print their name in connection with the book. The Lord challenges them to try to write a revelation and if they can't, they are commanded to stand as witnesses that the revelations are true.
Consequences: They appoint their best writers, but after many attempts, they acknowledge that Joseph is inspired in the revelations

Summary: Instructions at conference given regarding missionaries, Aaronic Bishops, and Baptism at age 8
Verse: Inasmuch as parents have children in Zion that teach them not to understand [the gospel] when eight years old, the sin be upon the parents.
Context: At a church conference focused on printing the revelations, revelations regarding individuals and church procedure were received. William McLellin was recently ordained to the Priesthood and wanted to know more about it.

Summary: John Whitmer to take revelations to Missouri with Oliver Cowdery
Verse: It is not wisdom in me that [Oliver] should be entrusted with the commandments and the moneys, which he shall carry to the land of Zion, except one go with him
Context: It is time to take the revelations to the printing press in Missouri and that mission needs more people, including the Church Historian

Summary: Stewards of scripture and spiritual things
Verse: I, the Lord, have ordained them to be stewards over the revelations and commandments which I have given unto them.
Content: Joseph Smith Jr., Martin Harris, Oliver Cowdery, John Whitmer, Sidney Rigdon, and W.W. Phelps are given stewardship over the revelations and Spiritual/Doctrinal purity

Summary: The Prophet is called to defend the Church against ex-mormons
Verse: The time has come that it is necessary and expedient that you should proclaim my gospel in the regions round about. Wherefore confound your enemies, call upon them to meet you in public and in private. No weapon that is formed against you shall prosper
Context: Persecution from Ezra Booth and Symonds Ryder is becoming more intense and widespread so Joseph and Sidney Rigdon are called to pause the Bible translation and defend the church against the apostates
Consequences: Joseph does offer to have a public discussion with Booth and Ryder but they turn him down. The mission lasts about 4-6 weeks until he is commanded to resume on January 10.

Summary: Newel K. Whitney called as Bishop and more duties are outlined
Verse: It is expedient for a Bishop to be appointed in this part of the Lord's vineyard (Kirtland). Newel K. Whitney is the man who shall be appointed and ordained… to keep the Lord's storehouse.
Context: Bishop Partridge has been planted in Zion and the Saints in Ohio need a local bishop

Summary: After pausing during the month of December to combat anti-mormon sentiments, Joseph is commanded to resume the bible translation
Verse: It is expedient that [those on missions] should continue preaching the gospel. It is expedient [for Joseph and Sidney] to translate [the Bible] again
Context: After preaching against Ezra Booth's false reports for the past 6 weeks, it is time to return to the Bible translation (see Section 71)

Summary: God clarifies Paul's words and affirms that children are holy
Verse: The apostle wrote a commandment, not of the Lord, but of himself, that a believer should not be united with an unbeliever… Little children are holy, being sanctified through the atonement of Christ
Context: The Lord clarifies 1 Corinthians 7:14 that little children are holy and infant baptism isn't needed. Children should be baptized at age 8 (see Section 68)

Summary: The Lord and the Church will provide for Missionaries families
Verse: If ye are faithful [missionaries], ye shall be laden with many sheaves and crowned with eternal life. It is the duty of the Church to support the families of those who are called to proclaim my gospel.
Context: At a church conference , the Lord calls 24 men on missions during the next summer. As a church of farmers, they knew they would miss out on the whole season. So the Lord promises to take care of their families if they have the faith to go.

Summary: A vision of the Degrees of Glory
Verse: And now, after the many testimonies which have been given of him, this is the testimony, last of all, which we give of him, that He lives! For we saw him, even on the right hand of God.
Context: While working on the new testament, it became clear to Joseph that many plain and precious things were missing and THE VISION was given

Summary: Keys to understand the book of Revelations
Context: While working on the bible translation, the Lord revealed the meaning of symbols to help understand the book of Revelations

Summary: The Church leaders start the United Firm
Verse: It must needs be that there be an organization of my people, in regulating the affairs of the storehouse for the poor of my people. For if ye are not equal in earthly things, ye cannot be equal in heavenly things
Context: The church leaders need an official business structure to combine the temporal affairs of the church (store, printing press, etc.)
Consequences: In this section, Joseph is told to travel to Missouri to help unify the leaders. He goes and gets there in April 1832 (section 82).

Summary: Jared Carter called to mission again
Context: Jared Carter was baptized in Colesville and moved to Ohio with the Colesville saints. He served various missions to the eastern states. His friends turned against him and his faith but he baptized 79 people between 1831 and 1834.
Consequences: Jared Carter shows up in Lucy Mack Smith's history by serving a mission in Detroit and baptizing the Deacon. Eventually, Carter makes it to Nauvoo but then says that the Spirit left him and he just quietly leaves the Church

Summary: Stephen Burnett called to preach
Verse: Thus saith the Lord unto Stephen Burnett, go ye into the world and preach the gospel. Wherefore, go ye and preach my gospel, whether to the North, South, East, or West, it mattereth not, for ye cannot go amiss.
Context: Stephen Burnett was 17 or 18 at this time and ready to preach. He was baptize in Oct 1831 and first called to serve in Jan 1832. This revelation in March tells him to go with Eden Smith (who gets sick). So two weeks later, Burnett leaves to preach with Eden's father.
Content: Don't get caught up in your mission assignment. Your assignment, location, or language can change. Focus on what to preach, not where or how
Consequences: Burnett eventually leaves the church during the Kirtland apostasy in 1838
